reviews.review_msg: Cristina is really kind. Her lectures are easy to follow and understand as long as you have done the readings. Besides this, this is a very tough marker and provides little criteria making it difficult to get a good grade. Shes nice, but I dont see myself taking another class with her.

I love Cristina. She's so sweet and genuinely cares about her students. I took SA364 with her and decided to take another SA course the following semester because she a great a prof. Attendance was mandatory and every class had a writing response activity although it was more of a pass/fail basis and basically was done for attendance.

I have absolutely nothing against this professor as a person; she is very sweet and caring, and really cares about student wellbeing. I just had a really tough time following what this class was trying to explain. Lectures were a bit confusing and unstructured, and involved a lot of group activities that didn't always seem to have relevance.

Christina is approachable and seems to have a high interest in the subject. She likes talking about Milan a lot! Her class arrangement is decent and the four hours were divided well with a variety of class discussion, lectures and video. However, there is a lack of clarity with the assignments and I would like to have learnt more about Anthropology
